member.summary: Type of module

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.ModuleType.External
member.summary: External (third-party)

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.CodeOptimization
member.summary: Code optimization settings

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.CodeOptimization.Never
member.summary: Code should never be optimized if possible.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.CodeOptimization.InNonDebugBuilds
member.summary: Code should only be optimized in non-debug builds (not in Debug).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.CodeOptimization.InShippingBuildsOnly
member.summary: Code should only be optimized in shipping builds (not in Debug, DebugGame, Development)

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.CodeOptimization.Always
member.summary: Code should always be optimized if possible.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.CodeOptimization.Default
member.summary: Default: 'InNonDebugBuilds' for game modules, 'Always' otherwise.

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PCHUsageMode
member.summary: What type of PCH to use for this module.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PCHUsageMode.Default
member.summary: Default: Engine modules use shared PCHs, game modules do not

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PCHUsageMode.NoSharedPCHs
member.summary: Never use shared PCHs. Always generate a unique PCH for this module if appropriate

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PCHUsageMode.UseSharedPCHs
member.summary: Shared PCHs are OK!

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PCHUsageMode.UseExplicitOrSharedPCHs
member.summary: Shared PCHs may be used if an explicit private PCH is not set through PrivatePCHHeaderFile. In either case, none of the source files manually include a module PCH, and should include a matching header instead.

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PrecompileTargetsType
member.summary: Which type of targets this module should be precompiled for

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PrecompileTargetsType.None
member.summary: Never precompile this module.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PrecompileTargetsType.Default
member.summary: Inferred from the module's directory. Engine modules under Engine/Source/Runtime will be compiled for games, those under Engine/Source/Editor will be compiled for the editor, etc...

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PrecompileTargetsType.Game
member.summary: Any game targets.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PrecompileTargetsType.Editor
member.summary: Any editor targets.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PrecompileTargetsType.Any
member.summary: Any targets.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.Target
member.summary: Rules for the target that this module belongs to

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.Type
member.summary: Type of module

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.BinariesSubFolder
member.summary: Subfolder of Binaries/PLATFORM folder to put this module in when building DLLs. This should only be used by modules that are found via searching like the TargetPlatform or ShaderFormat modules. If FindModules is not used to track them down, the modules will not be found.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.OptimizeCode
member.summary: When this module's code should be optimized.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PrivatePCHHeaderFile
member.summary: Explicit private PCH for this module. Implies that this module will not use a shared PCH.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.SharedPCHHeaderFile
member.summary: Header file name for a shared PCH provided by this module. Must be a valid relative path to a public C++ header file. This should only be set for header files that are included by a significant number of other C++ modules.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PCHUsage
member.summary: Precompiled header usage for this module

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.bUseRTTI
member.summary: Use run time type information

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.bUseAVX
member.summary: Use AVX instructions

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.bEnableBufferSecurityChecks
member.summary: Enable buffer security checks. This should usually be enabled as it prevents severe security risks.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.bEnableExceptions
member.summary: Enable exception handling

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.bEnableShadowVariableWarnings
member.summary: Enable warnings for shadowed variables

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.bEnableUndefinedIdentifierWarnings
member.summary: Enable warnings for using undefined identifiers in #if expressions

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.bFasterWithoutUnity
member.summary: If true and unity builds are enabled, this module will build without unity.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.MinSourceFilesForUnityBuildOverride
member.summary: The number of source files in this module before unity build will be activated for that module. If set to anything besides -1, will override the default setting which is controlled by MinGameModuleSourceFilesForUnityBuild

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.MinFilesUsingPrecompiledHeaderOverride
member.summary: Overrides BuildConfiguration.MinFilesUsingPrecompiledHeader if non-zero.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.bBuildLocallyWithSNDBS
member.summary: Module uses a #import so must be built locally when compiling with SN-DBS

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.IsRedistributableOverride
member.summary: Redistribution override flag for this module.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.bOutputPubliclyDistributable
member.summary: Whether the output from this module can be publicly distributed, even if it has code/ dependencies on modules that are not (i.e. CarefullyRedist, NotForLicensees, NoRedist). This should be used when you plan to release binaries but not source.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.WhitelistRestrictedFolders
member.summary: List of folders which are whitelisted to be referenced when compiling this binary, without propagating restricted folder names

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.bEnforceIWYU
member.summary: Enforce "include what you use" rules when PCHUsage is set to ExplicitOrSharedPCH; warns when monolithic headers (Engine.h, UnrealEd.h, etc...) are used, and checks that source files include their matching header first.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PublicIncludePathModuleNames
member.summary: List of modules names (no path needed) with header files that our module's public headers needs access to, but we don't need to "import" or link against.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PublicDependencyModuleNames
member.summary: List of public dependency module names (no path needed) (automatically does the private/public include). These are modules that are required by our public source files.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PrivateIncludePathModuleNames
member.summary: List of modules name (no path needed) with header files that our module's private code files needs access to, but we don't need to "import" or link against.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PrivateDependencyModuleNames
member.summary: List of private dependency module names. These are modules that our private code depends on but nothing in our public include files depend on.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.CircularlyReferencedDependentModules
member.summary: Only for legacy reason, should not be used in new code. List of module dependencies that should be treated as circular references. This modules must have already been added to either the public or private dependent module list.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PublicSystemIncludePaths
member.summary: List of system/library include paths - typically used for External (third party) modules. These are public stable header file directories that are not checked when resolving header dependencies.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PublicIncludePaths
member.summary: (This setting is currently not need as we discover all files from the 'Public' folder) List of all paths to include files that are exposed to other modules

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PrivateIncludePaths
member.summary: List of all paths to this module's internal include files, not exposed to other modules (at least one include to the 'Private' path, more if we want to avoid relative paths)

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PublicLibraryPaths
member.summary: List of system/library paths (directory of .lib files) - typically used for External (third party) modules

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PublicAdditionalLibraries
member.summary: List of additional libraries (names of the .lib files including extension) - typically used for External (third party) modules

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PublicFrameworks
member.summary: List of XCode frameworks (iOS and MacOS)

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PublicWeakFrameworks
member.summary: List of weak frameworks (for OS version transitions)

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PublicAdditionalFrameworks
member.summary: List of addition frameworks - typically used for External (third party) modules on Mac and iOS

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.AdditionalBundleResources
member.summary: List of addition resources that should be copied to the app bundle for Mac or iOS

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PublicAdditionalShadowFiles
member.summary: For builds that execute on a remote machine (e.g. iOS), this list contains additional files that need to be copied over in order for the app to link successfully. Source/header files and PCHs are automatically copied. Usually this is simply a list of precompiled third party library dependencies.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PublicDelayLoadDLLs
member.summary: List of delay load DLLs - typically used for External (third party) modules

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.Definitions
member.summary: Additional compiler definitions for this module

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.DynamicallyLoadedModuleNames
member.summary: Addition modules this module may require at run-time

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.PlatformSpecificDynamicallyLoadedModuleNames
member.summary: Extra modules this module may require at run time, that are on behalf of another platform (i.e. shader formats and the like)

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.RuntimeDependencies
member.summary: List of files which this module depends on at runtime. These files will be staged along with the target.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.ModuleRules.AdditionalPropertiesForReceipt
member.summary: List of additional properties to be added to the build receipt

member.summary: Which targets this module should be precompiled for

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.UEBuildPlatformSDK.GetPlatformAutoSDKSetupEnvVar
member.summary: Because most ManualSDK determination depends on reading env vars, if this process is spawned by a process that ALREADY set up AutoSDKs then all the SDK env vars will exist, and we will spuriously detect a Manual SDK. (children inherit the environment of the parent process). Therefore we write out an env var to set in the command file (OutputEnvVars.txt) such that child processes can determine if their manual SDK detection is bogus. Make it platform specific so that platforms can be in different states.

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.FileFilter
member.summary: Stores a set of rules, similar to p4 path specifications, which can be used to efficiently filter files in or out of a set. The rules are merged into a tree with nodes for each path fragments and rule numbers in each leaf, allowing tree traversal in an arbitrary order to how they are applied.

member.summary: Root node for the tree.

member.summary: The default node, which will match any path

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.FileFilter.Rules
member.summary: Terminating nodes for each rule added to the filter

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.Log
member.summary:
UAT/UBT Custom log system.
This lets you use any TraceListeners you want, but you should only call the static methods below, not call Trace.XXX directly, as the static methods This allows the system to enforce the formatting and filtering conventions we desire.
For posterity, we cannot use the Trace or TraceSource class directly because of our special log requirements: 1. We possibly capture the method name of the logging event. This cannot be done as a macro, so must be done at the top level so we know how many layers of the stack to peel off to get the real function. 2. We have a verbose filter we would like to apply to all logs without having to have each listener filter individually, which would require our string formatting code to run every time. 3. We possibly want to ensure severity prefixes are logged, but Trace.WriteXXX does not allow any severity info to be passed down.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.Log.bIsInitialized
member.summary: Guard our initialization. Mainly used by top level exception handlers to ensure its safe to call a logging function. In general user code should not concern itself checking for this.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.Log.LogLevel
member.summary: When true, verbose loggin is enabled.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.Log.bLogSeverity
member.summary: When true, warnings and errors will have a WARNING: or ERROR: prexifx, respectively.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.Log.bLogSources
member.summary: When true, logs will have the calling mehod prepended to the output as MethodName:

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.Log.bLogSourcesToConsole
member.summary: When true, console output will have the calling mehod prepended to the output as MethodName:

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.Log.bColorConsoleOutput
member.summary: When true, will detect warnings and errors and set the console output color to yellow and red.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.Log.Timer
member.summary: When configured, this tracks time since initialization to prepend a timestamp to each log.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.Log.bIsVerbose
member.summary: Expose the log level. This is a hack for ProcessResult.LogOutput, which wants to bypass our normal formatting scheme.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.Log.WriteOnceSet
member.summary: A collection of strings that have been already written once

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.Log.IsInitialized
member.summary: Allows code to check if the log system is ready yet. End users should NOT need to use this. It pretty much exists to work around startup issues since this is a global singleton.

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.Log.SetLoggingLevel(UnrealBuildTool.LogEventType)
member.summary: Allows us to change verbosity after initializing. This can happen since we initialize logging early, but then read the config and command line later, which could change this value.

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.Log.InitLogging(System.Boolean,UnrealBuildTool.LogEventType,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Diagnostics.TraceListener})
member.summary: This class allows InitLogging to be called more than once to work around chicken and eggs issues with logging and parsing command lines (see UBT startup code).
member.param: If true, the timestamp from Log init time will be prepended to all logs.
If true, warnings and errors will have a WARNING: and ERROR: prefix to them.
If true, logs will have the originating method name prepended to them.
If true, console output will have the originating method name appended to it.
Collection of trace listeners to attach to the Trace.Listeners, in addition to the Default listener. The existing listeners (except the Default listener) are cleared first.

member.param: Number of frames to skip to get to the originator of the log request.

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.TargetBuildEnvironment
member.summary: Specifies whether to share engine binaries and intermediates with other projects, or to create project-specific versions. By default, editor builds always use the shared build environment (and engine binaries are written to Engine/Binaries/Platform), but monolithic builds and programs do not (except in installed builds). Using the shared build environment prevents target-specific modifications to the build environment.

member.summary: Use the default build environment for this target type (and whether the engine is installed)

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetBuildEnvironment.Shared
member.summary: Engine binaries and intermediates are output to the engine folder. Target-specific modifications to the engine build environment will be ignored.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetBuildEnvironment.Unique
member.summary: Engine binaries and intermediates are specific to this target

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.CPPEnvironmentConfiguration.Definitions
member.summary: Settings exposed from the TargetRules instance

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.Name
member.summary: The name of this target.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.Platform
member.summary: Platform that this target is being built for.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.Configuration
member.summary: The configuration being built.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.Architecture
member.summary: Architecture that the target is being built for (or an empty string for the default).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.ProjectFile
member.summary: Path to the project file for the project containing this target.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.Type
member.summary: The type of target.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUsesSteam
member.summary: Whether the target uses Steam.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUsesCEF3
member.summary: Whether the target uses CEF3.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUsesSlate
member.summary: Whether the project uses visual Slate UI (as opposed to the low level windowing/messaging, which is always available).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseStaticCRT
member.summary: Forces linking against the static CRT. This is not fully supported across the engine due to the need for allocator implementations to be shared (for example), and TPS libraries to be consistent with each other, but can be used for utility programs.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bDebugBuildsActuallyUseDebugCRT
member.summary: Enables the debug C++ runtime (CRT) for debug builds. By default we always use the release runtime, since the debug version isn't particularly useful when debugging Unreal Engine projects, and linking against the debug CRT libraries forces our third party library dependencies to also be compiled using the debug CRT (and often perform more slowly). Often it can be inconvenient to require a separate copy of the debug versions of third party static libraries simply so that you can debug your program's code.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bOutputPubliclyDistributable
member.summary: Whether the output from this target can be publicly distributed, even if it has dependencies on modules that are in folders with special restrictions (eg. CarefullyRedist, NotForLicensees, NoRedist).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.UndecoratedConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies the configuration whose binaries do not require a "-Platform-Configuration" suffix.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bBuildAllPlugins
member.summary: Build all the plugins that we can find, even if they're not enabled. This is particularly useful for content-only projects, where you're building the UE4Editor target but running it with a game that enables a plugin.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.AdditionalPlugins
member.summary: A list of additional plugins which need to be included in this target. This allows referencing non-optional plugin modules which cannot be disabled, and allows building against specific modules in program targets which do not fit the categories in ModuleHostType.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.PakSigningKeysFile
member.summary: Path to the set of pak signing keys to embed in the executable.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.SolutionDirectory
member.summary: Allows a Program Target to specify it's own solution folder path.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bOutputToEngineBinaries
member.summary: Output the executable to the engine binaries folder.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bShouldCompileAsDLL
member.summary: Whether this target should be compiled as a DLL. Requires LinkType to be set to TargetLinkType.Monolithic.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.ExeBinariesSubFolder
member.summary: Subfolder to place executables in, relative to the default location.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.GeneratedCodeVersion
member.summary: Allow target module to override UHT code generation version.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompilePhysX
member.summary: Whether to include PhysX support.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileAPEX
member.summary: Whether to include PhysX APEX support.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileNvCloth
member.summary: Whether to include NvCloth.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bRuntimePhysicsCooking
member.summary: Whether to allow runtime cooking of physics.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileBox2D
member.summary: Whether to include Box2D support.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileICU
member.summary: Whether to include ICU unicode/i18n support in Core.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileCEF3
member.summary: Whether to compile CEF3 support.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bBuildEditor
member.summary: Whether to compile the editor or not. Only desktop platforms (Windows or Mac) will use this, other platforms force this to false.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bBuildRequiresCookedData
member.summary: Whether to compile code related to building assets. Consoles generally cannot build assets. Desktop platforms generally can.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bBuildWithEditorOnlyData
member.summary: Whether to compile WITH_EDITORONLY_DATA disabled. Only Windows will use this, other platforms force this to false.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bBuildDeveloperTools
member.summary: Whether to compile the developer tools.

member.summary: Whether to force compiling the target platform modules, even if they wouldn't normally be built.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceBuildShaderFormats
member.summary: Whether to force compiling shader format modules, even if they wouldn't normally be built.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileSimplygon
member.summary: Whether we should compile in support for Simplygon or not.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileSimplygonSSF
member.summary: Whether we should compile in support for Simplygon's SSF library or not.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileLeanAndMeanUE
member.summary: Whether to compile lean and mean version of UE.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileAgainstEngine
member.summary: Enabled for all builds that include the engine project. Disabled only when building standalone apps that only link with Core.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileAgainstCoreUObject
member.summary: Enabled for all builds that include the CoreUObject project. Disabled only when building standalone apps that only link with Core.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bIncludeADO
member.summary: If true, include ADO database support in core.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileRecast
member.summary: Whether to compile Recast navmesh generation.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileSpeedTree
member.summary: Whether to compile SpeedTree support.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceEnableExceptions
member.summary: Enable exceptions for all modules.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceEnableRTTI
member.summary: Enable RTTI for all modules.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bWithServerCode
member.summary: Compile server-only code.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileWithStatsWithoutEngine
member.summary: Whether to include stats support even without the engine.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileWithPluginSupport
member.summary: Whether to include plugin support.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bWithPerfCounters
member.summary: Whether to include PerfCounters support.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseLoggingInShipping
member.summary: Whether to turn on logging for test/shipping builds.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bLoggingToMemoryEnabled
member.summary: Whether to turn on logging to memory for test/shipping builds.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseLauncherChecks
member.summary: Whether to check that the process was launched through an external launcher.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseChecksInShipping
member.summary: Whether to turn on checks (asserts) for test/shipping builds.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileFreeType
member.summary: True if we need FreeType support.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCompileForSize
member.summary: True if we want to favor optimizing size over speed.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceCompileDevelopmentAutomationTests
member.summary: Whether to compile development automation tests.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceCompilePerformanceAutomationTests
member.summary: Whether to compile performance automation tests.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bEventDrivenLoader
member.summary: If true, event driven loader will be used in cooked builds. @todoio This needs to be replaced by a runtime solution after async loading refactor.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bEnforceIWYU
member.summary: Enforce "include what you use" rules; warns if monolithic headers (Engine.h, UnrealEd.h, etc...) are used, and checks that source files include their matching header first.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bHasExports
member.summary: Whether the final executable should export symbols.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bPrecompile
member.summary: Make static libraries for all engine modules as intermediates for this target.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUsePrecompiled
member.summary: Use existing static libraries for all engine modules in this target.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bEnableOSX109Support
member.summary: Whether we should compile with support for OS X 10.9 Mavericks. Used for some tools that we need to be compatible with this version of OS X.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bIsBuildingConsoleApplication
member.summary: True if this is a console application that's being built.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bDisableSymbolCache
member.summary: True if debug symbols that are cached for some platforms should not be created.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseUnityBuild
member.summary: Whether to unify C++ code into larger files for faster compilation.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceUnityBuild
member.summary: Whether to force C++ source files to be combined into larger files for faster compilation.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseAdaptiveUnityBuild
member.summary: Use a heuristic to determine which files are currently being iterated on and exclude them from unity blobs, result in faster incremental compile times. The current implementation uses the read-only flag to distinguish the working set, assuming that files will be made writable by the source control system if they are being modified. This is true for Perforce, but not for Git.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bAdaptiveUnityDisablesOptimizations
member.summary: Disable optimization for files that are in the adaptive non-unity working set.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bAdaptiveUnityDisablesPCH
member.summary: Disables force-included PCHs for files that are in the adaptive non-unity working set.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.MinGameModuleSourceFilesForUnityBuild
member.summary: The number of source files in a game module before unity build will be activated for that module. This allows small game modules to have faster iterative compile times for single files, at the expense of slower full rebuild times. This setting can be overridden by the bFasterWithoutUnity option in a module's Build.cs file.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bShadowVariableErrors
member.summary: Forces shadow variable warnings to be treated as errors on platforms that support it.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUndefinedIdentifierErrors
member.summary: Forces the use of undefined identifiers in conditional expressions to be treated as errors.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseFastMonoCalls
member.summary: New Monolithic Graphics drivers have optional "fast calls" replacing various D3d functions

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseFastSemanticsRenderContexts
member.summary: New Xbox driver supports a "fast semantics" context type. This switches it on for the immediate and deferred contexts Try disabling this if you see rendering issues and/or crashes inthe Xbox RHI.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.NumIncludedBytesPerUnityCPP
member.summary: An approximate number of bytes of C++ code to target for inclusion in a single unified C++ file.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bStressTestUnity
member.summary: Whether to stress test the C++ unity build robustness by including all C++ files files in a project from a single unified file.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForceDebugInfo
member.summary: Whether to force debug info to be generated.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bDisableDebugInfo
member.summary: Whether to globally disable debug info generation; see DebugInfoHeuristics.cs for per-config and per-platform options.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bDisableDebugInfoForGeneratedCode
member.summary: Whether to disable debug info generation for generated files. This improves link times for modules that have a lot of generated glue code.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bOmitPCDebugInfoInDevelopment
member.summary: Whether to disable debug info on PC in development builds (for faster developer iteration, as link times are extremely fast with debug info disabled).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUsePDBFiles
member.summary: Whether PDB files should be used for Visual C++ builds.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUsePCHFiles
member.summary: Whether PCH files should be used.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.MinFilesUsingPrecompiledHeader
member.summary: The minimum number of files that must use a pre-compiled header before it will be created and used.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bForcePrecompiledHeaderForGameModules
member.summary: When enabled, a precompiled header is always generated for game modules, even if there are only a few source files in the module. This greatly improves compile times for iterative changes on a few files in the project, at the expense of slower full rebuild times for small game projects. This can be overridden by setting MinFilesUsingPrecompiledHeaderOverride in a module's Build.cs file.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseIncrementalLinking
member.summary: Whether to use incremental linking or not. Incremental linking can yield faster iteration times when making small changes. Currently disabled by default because it tends to behave a bit buggy on some computers (PDB-related compile errors).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bAllowLTCG
member.summary: Whether to allow the use of link time code generation (LTCG).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bAllowASLRInShipping
member.summary: Whether to allow the use of ASLR (address space layout randomization) if supported. Only applies to shipping builds.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bSupportEditAndContinue
member.summary: Whether to support edit and continue. Only works on Microsoft compilers in 32-bit compiles.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bOmitFramePointers
member.summary: Whether to omit frame pointers or not. Disabling is useful for e.g. memory profiling on the PC.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bStripSymbolsOnIOS
member.summary: Whether to strip iOS symbols or not (implied by bGeneratedSYMFile).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseMallocProfiler
member.summary: If true, then enable memory profiling in the build (defines USE_MALLOC_PROFILER=1 and forces bOmitFramePointers=false).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseSharedPCHs
member.summary: Enables "Shared PCHs", a feature which significantly speeds up compile times by attempting to share certain PCH files between modules that UBT detects is including those PCH's header files.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseShippingPhysXLibraries
member.summary: True if Development and Release builds should use the release configuration of PhysX/APEX.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseCheckedPhysXLibraries
member.summary: True if Development and Release builds should use the checked configuration of PhysX/APEX. if bUseShippingPhysXLibraries is true this is ignored.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCheckLicenseViolations
member.summary: Tells the UBT to check if module currently being built is violating EULA.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bBreakBuildOnLicenseViolation
member.summary: Tells the UBT to break build if module currently being built is violating EULA.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bUseFastPDBLinking
member.summary: Whether to use the :FASTLINK option when building with /DEBUG to create local PDBs on Windows. Fast, but currently seems to have problems finding symbols in the debugger.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCreateMapFile
member.summary: Outputs a map file as part of the build.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bEnableCodeAnalysis
member.summary: Enables code analysis mode. Currently, this has specific requirements. It only works on Windows platform with the MSVC compiler. Also, it requires a version of the compiler that supports the /analyze option, such as Visual Studio 2013.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.BundleVersion
member.summary: Bundle version for Mac apps.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bDeployAfterCompile
member.summary: Whether to deploy the executable after compilation on platforms that require deployment.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCreateStubIPA
member.summary: If true, then a stub IPA will be generated when compiling is done (minimal files needed for a valid IPA).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCopyAppBundleBackToDevice
member.summary: If true, then a stub IPA will be generated when compiling is done (minimal files needed for a valid IPA).

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bAllowRemotelyCompiledPCHs
member.summary: When enabled, allows XGE to compile pre-compiled header files on remote machines. Otherwise, PCHs are always generated locally.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bCheckSystemHeadersForModification
member.summary: Whether headers in system paths should be checked for modification when determining outdated actions.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bDisableLinking
member.summary: Whether to disable linking for this target.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bFormalBuild
member.summary: Indicates that this is a formal build, intended for distribution. This flag is automatically set to true when Build.version has a changelist set. The only behavior currently bound to this flag is to compile the default resource file separately for each binary so that the OriginalFilename field is set correctly. By default, we only compile the resource once to reduce build times.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bFlushBuildDirOnRemoteMac
member.summary: Whether to clean Builds directory on a remote Mac before building.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.bPrintToolChainTimingInfo
member.summary: Whether to write detailed timing info from the compiler and linker.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.PCHOutputDirectory
member.summary: The directory to put precompiled header files in. Experimental setting to allow using a path on a faster drive. Defaults to the standard output directory if not set.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.TargetRules.LinkType
member.summary: Specifies how to link modules in this target (monolithic or modular). This is currently protected for backwards compatibility. Call the GetLinkType() accessor until support for the deprecated ShouldCompileMonolithic() override has been removed.

member.summary: Backing storage for the LinkType property.

member.summary: Backing storage for the LaunchModuleName property.

member.summary: List of additional modules to be compiled into the target.

member.summary: Specifies the build environment for this target. See TargetBuildEnvironment for more infomation on the available options.

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.VersionManifest
member.summary:
Stores the version (or a unique build ID) for the build products of an application in a certain folder.
Allows the runtime to identify which modules are used for which files, and at which version they're at. This prevents stale binaries from being loaded by the runtime when making a local unversioned build, and allows faster incremental builds than compiling the build changelist into every module when making versioned builds.

The changelist that these modules are compatible with

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.UEDeployIOS.VersionUtilities.PullApartVersion(System.String,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.String@)
member.summary: Pulls apart a version string of one of the two following formats: "7301.15 11-01 10:28" (Major.Minor Date Time) "7486.0" (Major.Minor)

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.UEDeployIOS.VersionUtilities.CalculateUpdatedMinorVersionString(System.String)
member.summary:
Parses the version string (expected to be of the form major.minor or major) Also parses the major.minor from the running version file and increments it's minor by 1.
If the running version major matches and the running version minor is newer, then the bundle version is updated.
In either case, the running version is set to the current bundle version number and written back out.
member.returns: The (possibly updated) bundle version

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.UEDeployIOS.VersionUtilities.UpdateBundleVersion(System.String)
member.summary: Updates the minor version in the CFBundleVersion key of the specified PList if this is a new package. Also updates the key EpicAppVersion with the bundle version and the current date/time (no year)

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.UEBuildPlatform.UseAbsolutePathsInUnityFiles
member.summary: Whether this platform requires the use of absolute paths in Unity files. The compiler will try to combine paths in each #include directive with the standard include paths, and unity files in intermediate directories can result in the maximum path length being exceeded on Windows. On the other hand, remote compilation requires relative paths so dependency checking works correctly on the local machine as well as on the remote machine.
member.returns: bool true if it is required, false if not

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bIgnoreOutdatedImportLibraries
member.summary: Whether to ignore import library files that are out of date when building targets. Set this to true to improve iteration time. By default we don't bother relinking targets if only a dependent .lib has changed, as chances are that the import library wasn't actually different unless a dependent header file of this target was also changed, in which case the target would be rebuilt automatically.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bSkipBuild
member.summary: Skip building; just do setup and terminate.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bUseIncludeDependencyResolveCache
member.summary: Whether the dependency cache includes pre-resolved include locations so UBT doesn't have to re-resolve each include location just to check the timestamp. This is technically not fully correct because the dependency cache is global and each module could have a different set of include paths that could cause headers to resolve files differently. In practice this is not the case, and significantly speeds up UBT when nothing is to be done.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bTestIncludeDependencyResolveCache
member.summary: Used to test the dependency resolve cache. This will verify the resolve cache has no conflicts by resolving every time and checking against any previous resolve attempts.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bUseUBTMakefiles
member.summary:
Enables support for very fast iterative builds by caching target data. Turning this on causes Unreal Build Tool to emit 'UBT Makefiles' for targets when they're built the first time. Subsequent builds will load these Makefiles and begin outdatedness checking and build invocation very quickly. The caveat is that if source files are added or removed to the project, UBT will need to gather information about those in order for your build to complete successfully. Currently, you must run the project file generator after adding/removing source files to tell UBT to re-gather this information.
Events that can invalidate the 'UBT Makefile': - Adding/removing .cpp files - Adding/removing .h files with UObjects - Adding new UObject types to a file that didn't previously have any - Changing global build settings (most settings in this file qualify.) - Changed code that affects how Unreal Header Tool works
You can force regeneration of the 'UBT Makefile' by passing the '-gather' argument, or simply regenerating project files
This also enables the fast include file dependency scanning and caching system that allows Unreal Build Tool to detect out of date dependencies very quickly. When enabled, a deep C++ include graph does not have to be generated, and instead we only scan and cache indirect includes for after a dependent build product was already found to be out of date. During the next build, we'll load those cached indirect includes and check for outdatedness.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.BuildConfiguration.bUseUHTMakefiles
member.summary: Enables support for fast UHT parsing by caching results of previous UHT runs. If a module or *.uhtmanifest gets changed, all modules up to first changed one get loaded from makefile and the rest is parsed regularly. This feature is new and can have issues that weren't discovered in isolated testing so disabling by default.

member.summary: The type of project files to generate

member.name: T:UnrealBuildTool.ProjectFileGenerator
member.summary: Base class for all project file generators

members.member: Global static that enables generation of project files. Doesn't actually compile anything. This is enabled only via UnrealBuildTool command-line.
True if we're generating lightweight project files for a single game only, excluding most engine code, documentation, etc.
Optional list of platforms to generate projects for
When bGeneratingGameProjectFiles=true, this is the game name we're generating projects for

Global static that only adds platforms that are supported when generating a given target. This was the old behavior, and it resulted in scenarios where having an unsupported platform selected in the platform drop-down would silently 'switch' to building Win32. The new behavior is to add all platforms when generating a target, and then check if it is supported at build time. If it is not, then a BuildException is thrown informing the user of an unsupported platform. NOTE: This only matters when using "-AllProjects". It can increase the project file load times though, because of all of the extra project configuration combinations we need to store
Whether we should include configurations for "Test" and "Shipping" in generated projects (pass "-NoShippingConfigs" to disable this)
True if intellisense data should be generated (takes a while longer)
True if we should include documentation in the generated projects
True if all documentation languages should be included in generated projects, otherwise only "INT" will be included
True if build targets should pass the -useprecompiled argument
True if we should include engine source in the generated solution
True if shader source files should be included in the generated projects
True if build system files should be included
True if we should include config files (.ini files) in the generated project
True if we should include localization files (.int/.kor/etc files) in the generated project
True if we should include template files (.template files) in the generated project
True if we should include program projects in the generated solution

True if we should reflect "Source" sub-directories on disk in the master project as master project directories. This arguably adds some visual clutter to the master project, but is truer to the on-disk file organization.
Relative path to the directory where the master project file will be saved to
Name of the UE4 engine project name that contains all of the engine code, config files and other files
When ProjectsAreIntermediate is true, this is the directory to store generated project files
Path to timestamp file, recording when was the last time projects were created.
Global static new line string used by ProjectFileGenerator to generate project files.

If true, we'll parse subdirectories of third-party projects to locate source and header files to include in the generated projects. This can make the generated projects quite a bit bigger, but makes it easier to open files directly from the IDE.
Name of the master project file (e.g. base file name for the solution file for Visual Studio, or the Xcode project file on Mac)

Maps all module names that were included in generated project files, to actual project file objects. @todo projectfiles: Nasty global static list. This is only really used for IntelliSense, and to avoid extra folder searches for projects we've already cached source files for.
If generating project files for a single project, the path to its .uproject file.

When generating IntelliSense data, we may want to only generate data for a specific project file, even if other targets make use of modules in this project file. This is useful to prevent unusual or hacky global definitions from Programs affecting the Editor/Engine modules. We always want the most common and useful definitions to be set when working with solutions with many modules.
File extension for project files we'll be generating (e.g. ".vcxproj")
True if we should include IntelliSense data in the generated project files when possible

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.ProjectFileComparer.CompareOrdinalIgnoreWhitespaceAndCase(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compares two project files ignoring whitespaces, case and GUIDs.
member.remarks: Compares two specified String objects by evaluating the numeric values of the corresponding Char objects in each string. Only space and tabulation characters are ignored. Ignores leading whitespaces at the beginning of each line and differences in whitespace sequences between matching non-whitespace sub-strings.
member.returns: An integer that indicates the lexical relationship between the two comparands.

member.name: M:UnrealBuildTool.Unity.FileCollection.AddVirtualFile(System.Int64)
member.summary: Doesn't actually add a file, but instead reserves space. This is used with "bUseAdaptiveUnityBuild", to prevent other compiled unity blobs in the module's numbered set from having to be recompiled after we eject source files one of that module's unity blobs. Basically, it can prevent dozens of files from being recompiled after the first time building after your working set of source files changes
member.param: Length of the virtual file to add to this file collection

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.UnrealBuildTool.IsGatheringBuild
member.summary: True if we should gather module dependencies for building in this run. If this is false, then we'll expect to be loading information from disk about the target's modules before we'll be able to build anything. One or both of IsGatheringBuild or IsAssemblingBuild must be true.

member.name: P:UnrealBuildTool.UnrealBuildTool.IsAssemblingBuild
member.summary: True if we should go ahead and actually compile and link in this run. If this is false, no actions will be executed and we'll stop after gathering and saving information about dependencies. One or both of IsGatheringBuild or IsAssemblingBuild must be true.

member.name: F:UnrealBuildTool.UnrealBuildTool.bNeedsFullCPPIncludeRescan
member.summary: Used when BuildConfiguration.bUseUBTMakefiles is enabled. If true, it means that our cached includes may not longer be valid (or never were), and we need to recover by forcibly scanning included headers for all build prerequisites to make sure that our cached set of includes is actually correct, before determining which files are outdated.
